European culture has contributed greatly to the knowledge of the world in advances in the sciences, the arts and a wide variety of fields. This is attested to by the fact that the most developed countries are either founded on European culture or have adopted large parts of it.
 
 However, the relative success of European culture says very little about the worth of European blood lines and race. Peoples from Asia and throughout the world have shown that it is not the race which determines a person's success but the culture which he personally practices. A white child raised only with the same meger opportunities and illiterate uneducated survivalist culture as reside in war-torn third world countries will be very unlikely to be successful. A black child given an average upper-middle-class American upbringing has a fairly good chance of being succesful. It is culture and upbringing, not race, that make a people great.
 
 By the way, I do not claim that European culture is the only one with positive characteristics nor do I claim that European culture ONLY has positive characteristics since many ugly things were done by Europeans as well.

 Well Scotland has seen its fair share of invasions, first of all we have the native Celtic people called the Picts. Then an invasion from Northern Ireland from a Celtic people called the Scotia(or Scots). 
 
 Two kingdoms existed in Scotland at the time Pictland and Dal Rai, they then combined to form Scotland when a Scotia King with Pictish blood came to the throne. Since that time around about 9th Century Scotland has existed as a country, supposedly Scotland is the oldest Country still in existence today.
 
 About the time of Scotia and Picts the island of Britain suffered many invasions by the Vikings, these Vikings even setup separate Kingdoms in modern day Scotland. These include Orkney and Shetland, and the Western Isles just off the coast of Scotland. These island Kingdoms did not join Scotland until 11-12 th Centuries. Orkney and Shetland are still very Nordic in nature they have some of the same festivals as other Norse peoples.
 
 We(Scotland) are a mongrel nation, we have saying that We're aw Jock Tamson's Bairns. This means that despite all our apparent difference we are the same underneath, which I think is a great guiding princple for any Society.

 You advocate the genocide of White people, and you seem to advocate the mixing of all the peoples of the Earth just to achieve victory over "racism". You would have people lose their distinctive features of mind, of character, of body, and culture so they could all degenerate into a raceless human mass.
 
 Keep in mind, however, that no culture ever came out of human hodgepodge devoid of any identity. Rather, culture arose from unique, differentiated units of human groups known as nations or races. All the gains achieved through millennia of costlt evolutionary development are the very differences you hate so much. These differences are spiritual, mental, and physical and they distinguish races from one another.
 
 Call me a "racist" if you will, but I want races to remain distinct races because it is only through these distinguishing and character-giving differences that life can acquire and transmit any significance.
 
 So when, for the sake of "peace" or "anti-racism" people of different races begin to melt together and lose their distinctive features and traits, it means only one thing: they are losing their instincts by which they are able to maintain themselves in life, vigor, and beauty. It would be like casting aside eons of evolution and reducing roses, snapdragons, tulips, and lillies to one flower which slightly resembles each of its ancestors but possesses none of their beauty or fragrance.

 What you consider "the best food" is entirely your opinion and not fact. Whether a country is developing or not, does not take away it's value. Remember, Italy has taken from other cultures too.
Existantia
in relation to the first post, that whack job deserves no regard...mainly because they're a whack job....we'll all be beige in about 30 years anyways people.
Another opinion

Im sorry, but you're pedestalling Europeans. Don't get me wrong. There are some wonderful things about Europe. Europeans made the most technological advancements? I dont know, Japan can kick our XXX. But to say Europe is "better" than the rest of the world is really narrow-minded. We are also learning amazing things about Egypt and Maiian cultures that amaze ad baffle us. Maybe not in relation to technology, but in science. 
 
 Europe - Peaceful continent? There are social, political, racial conflicts and unrest all over the world. You can't shove a whole continent, nay the whole REST OF THE WORLD into one category. I know plenty of places in Asia that are peaceful. 
 
 What you consider "the best food" is entirely your opinion and not fact. Whether a country is developing or not, does not take away it's value. Remember, Italy has taken from other cultures too.

 Jumping into this discussion, I don't think that European culture should be pedestalled but occasionally there are people who would reject all of European culture because of resentment against the negative aspects of European culture (mainly the colonization and racism of earlier times). That is "throwing the baby out with the bathwater". Gman's posts reflect some of this rejections of European culture.
 
 I personally think that all cultures need to be judged objectively and that people should adapt the best (as they see it) from all the cultures that they come in contact with and not feel obliged to stick rigidly to their own culture of origin. Cultural identity can be all well and good but to stick to a negative aspect of a culture out of a sense of loyalty would be foolish. For example, American culture could adapt more of the sense of community that exists in many other cultures. Often the traditional American sense of the primacy of the rugged individual can be taken too far and can blind people to the advantages of a worldview that promotes community responsibilities and benefits.
 
 I don't care if the races physically mix themselves out of individual existence. My main concern is that the best aspects of European culture (indeed, the best aspects of all cultures) be preserved by whatever racially mixed group eventually arises.
Existantia

Cultural identity can be all well and good but to stick to a negative aspect of a culture out of a sense of loyalty would be foolish. For example, American culture could adapt more of the sense of community that exists in many other cultures. Often the traditional American sense of the primacy of the rugged individual can be taken too far and can blind people to the advantages of a worldview that promotes community responsibilities and benefits.
 I agree with you there.
 
 
 I don't care if the races physically mix themselves out of individual existence. My main concern is that the best aspects of European culture (indeed, the best aspects of all cultures) be preserved by whatever racially mixed group eventually arises.
 I agree. [/QUOTE] If they prove to be useful, then they will be. Depends what you consider the "best", really. Right now, European culture is still quite alive in African/South American/Asian countries.
cake.or.death

[size=4][b]This, ladies, is a deviation from Nature -- because it kills your valuable European bloodline.

 
 I'm pretty sure that the European Union is doing a lot to encourage the integration of different races and nationalities through the introduction of a common currency, for example. Or maybe the encouragement of migration and multiple language lessons in public education? If Europeans themselves are making tracks to encourage diversity, surely those who are proud of their heritage should follow suit?
Shooterandproud

I am proud of my European heritage, too - but they sure as hell do not have the best food.

 
 Thats my opinion. Pizza beats rice hands down.
 
 
 
South America and Asia has Europe beat hands down.

 
 South American food is good, but not as good as italian, and Sushi is pretty good, if you like intestinal worms.
 
 
 
Indian, Thai, Chinese, Japanese, Mexican, Cajun - mmm food with such kicken flavor. I used to live in Spain and carried a bottle of Tobasco with me everywhere. Bland bland bland (except Paella). Same with Scandinavian and Brittish. Italy, France and Portugal do a little better.

 
 I'm not a real spicy fan.
 
 But don't get me wrong. Asian culture is great an all. I like Chinese Food, read Manga comics, play nintendo stuff, and train in kung fu. But when it comes to food, no one can compete with Italy.
jazyjason

Womanly Intuition Tells Us: Racial Mixing is Wrong
 
 The tragedy unfolding before us is the planned disappearance of the White race through the process of racial blending and replacement. The corporate media and the bought politicians define any resistance to this tragedy as "evil racism." According to them, we are not allowed to resist the continuing obliteration of our race, but are ordered to appreciate it.
 
 Hello ladies. My name is Debbie O'Connor. I am a mother and a grandmother. I reside in Tennessee and I have a message for you, woman to woman. Barely a day goes by I do not see young White girls and grown White women with mixed race children; children that have no true racial identity. This, ladies, is a deviation from Nature -- because it kills your valuable European bloodline.
 
 Do you really want your daughter or granddaughter to come home from the hospital with a mixed race baby that will never be accepted by its peers of either race? After all, a Black couple can no more give birth to a White baby than a White couple can give birth to a Black baby. The reason is because each race was created within a divine plan; to fulfill its own destiny as only that race is capable of doing. This is a law of Nature.
 
 Continued:
 
 http://www.nationalvanguard.org/story.php?id=9117
 
 Or listen:
 
 http://www.nationalvanguard.org/docs/audio/fr20060530.mp3
 
 
 
 .

 
 
 I cant believe he even posted this ####. She says it's divine which is an alliby hitler used in the holocaust and then also on the las of nature which hitler also used in the propaganda films of the origin of the aryian race in the hymilaians. 
 
 This is just stupid and racist beyond belief. Race doesnt make the person the person makes the race. You are to be proud of your culture and to be proud of others culture. This kind of thinking just shows how warpeed the minds of some people still are. Just sickening.

 Mmmmmmm, Italian food truly is the exception in Europe. (Found a great little Italian place when I was in Monterey recently.) I also love Greek food. However my heritage is scandanavian - - how many boiled potatoes can one eat? I also lived in Spain for a year and with the exception of flan and paella I had to add tobasco to everything to get some flavor. And I have to admit I love both sushi and spicy! :)

 Yup. I also heard french food was good, but I've never had it.

Sushi is good, however I'm sometimes afraid to eat it. I mean, uncooked fish. That scares me.

 
 Not all sushi is uncooked fish - there are some where it is cooked and some that are vegetarian. I LOVE sushi. Especially the rolls - salmon and eel. Nummy nummy nummy.
 
 
Firstly, please stop stereotyping national foods and cultures.

 
 I really don't think he was. He was talking about what food he likes/dislikes/ etc. 
 
 
Secondly, what on earth has this got to do with mixed race marriages?

 
 Not a damned thing - but scope creep is common in many threads. Plus this is an old thread started by now banned white supremist. Chewing his dumb XXX out now falls on deaf ears. And technically the thread was never about mixed marriages, but mixed children.
